contextId.information: Here "heart" refers to the king, and "feeling happy" is an idiom that means he was drunk. AT: "the king was drunk with wine" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: the king's heart was feeling happy because of the wine

contextId.information: Here "hands" stands for the men. To "weigh out" is an idiom that means to pay them. AT: "I will pay ... to the men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: I will weigh out ... into the hands of those

contextId.information: This represents all that Haman had owned. AT: "all that had belonged to Haman" or "all of Haman's property" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
